oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Miss Mary Hall interview : World War I
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hall, Mary
oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: Bullen, Bob, interviewer; Nunley, Joe, commentator
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Mary Hall discusses what life was like during World War I, including saying goodbye to soldiers at the train station and working with her mother for the Red Cross
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Hall, Mary Ella, 1895-1991; World War, 1914-1918; American Association of the Red Cross
